headline: Need a lot of changes
pros:
1. Good internal benefits-allowances. One of the banks paying highest leased rent accommodation.
2. Job security
3. Loans at attractive rates.
4. Women employees are treated with empathy
cons:
1. No value for the employees, who had been working in the bank for years. Outsiders are given opportunity for the present openings. Internal employees are not even informed about the oppourtunities, leave aside preferences.. They are considered inferior even to apply for the openings.
2. Worst performance rating systems. Career progression of an employee depends on the rating system. And rating system depends on the immediate superiors. Favouritism at its core. 
3. Worst whistle blowing system.
4. Nil work life balance.
5. No system to escalate the issues. It should be reported to the manager. If the manager is the reason for the conflict, then there is no scope even for complaining.
6. No transparency in promotions.
7.  Government had instructed to keep afloat the basic banking services, during the lockdown. Instruction from HR was also the same. But there was so much pressure from higher ups, to attend the office everyday, even for back offices. Even when the necessary infrastructure was in place, WFH was seen as a taboo.  50% strength was not maintained in many branches/offices. There were many employees affected by the disease, due to the inhumane approach.

headline: Manager
pros: The company and it's employees are highly unethical.
cons:
The company has intro an scheme of increasing its loan portfolio by extending education loans to people for training at Manipal and employing them at bank after completion of training.

People after completion of training are posted as probationary officer. The seniors at the bank know that the probationary officers have availed loan for completion of training, hence they make them do all the unethical work which will theses probationary officers chargesheet at a later stage.

One of the instances is making probationary officers do clerical job of handling cash and going to clearing house. Clearing house has strict rule of allowing only clerical staff. Seniors at the bank make probationary officers lie in clearing house that they are from clerical grade. The same needs to be registered with clearing house which will further add trouble to probationary officer as they are forcibly asked to lie in clearing house.
Seniors at the bank ask probationary officers to handle cash of customers without passing them through note detector machine for premium customers which is against the guidelines of Reserve Bank of India. The reason behind doing so is that the customer will replace the complete bundle in case counterfeit note is found which is again against the guidelines of Reserve Bank of India.
In case the probationary officers deny doing so, they are terminated and are asked to repay education loan at prevailing rate. The bank and it's senior management are completely unethical.
Please don't get into trap of this kind of employment.
